title: Calories in Fried Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in fried rice per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tips for variations like adding protein or reducing oil.
assumptions: Vegetable fried rice with eggs, cooked in vegetable oil; includes white rice, mixed veggies (carrots, peas), soy sauce; ~1 cup serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, oil used, and brand; homemade vs. restaurant differs. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 200 g (about 1 cup) of vegetable fried rice contains ~340 kcal, mainly from carbs with moderate fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 50 g cooked chicken per 100 g rice
Use less oil (halve the 1 tbsp per 100 g)
Brown rice instead of white per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of fried rice?
faqs.a: About 340 kcal for 200 g vegetable fried rice.

faqs.q: Is fried rice high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, ~48 g carbs in 200 g, mostly from rice.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in fried rice?
faqs.a: Around 800 mg in 200 g due to soy sauce; can vary.

faqs.q: Calories in restaurant vs. homemade fried rice?
faqs.a: Restaurant often higher (400+ kcal per cup) from extra oil and portions.

faqs.q: Can I make fried rice lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, use less oil, add more veggies, or choose brown rice to cut ~40-50 kcal per 100 g.
